intro: Meibomia microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited meibomia, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruits are small, capsule-like structures that contain numerous tiny seeds. Meibomia microcarpa is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and shrublands.
